Message.Title: Project Shield Will Launch With Nvidia Grid With Telco Partners?
Message.Msg: You talk about a killer app. Perhaps first launch is WiFi only and then for the XMAS season the Telco LTE launch. Project Shield Two SKUs WiFi - 32GB storage - $299 WiFi & LTE - 32GB storage - $399 Nvidia Grid from AT&T and T-mobile unsubsidized. ho knows what the subsidized price would be maybe $199. Note: Project shield comes with a micro SD slot so probably won't have the Apple business model of charging $100 for $8 worth of Flash. Remember Jensen said at CES that they had 12 Telco trials in progress world wide. Agawi has stated they have telco trials on going with several Tier one providers in the US alone. Note: perfect business model for the Telco's because they data centers all over the country. Just stick the Nvidia Grid rack in an one area and turn on the service. BOM Cost WIFi only

Topic.Title: Project Shield Will Launch With Nvidia Grid With Telco Partners?

Message.Msg: message got cut off BOM cost WiFi only less than $150 WiFi and LTE less than $170 P.S. Almost all of the videos with a Nvidia Rep talking about Nvidia Grid and Project Shield mention that if the client has a Tegra 4 in it the latency will be slightly better. Great without but just a little better with. Makes sense for nvidia to build that in don't you think? We should know more March 19th! JMHO

Topic.Title: Project Shield will sell for $300-$400

Message.Msg: $300 selling established gaming systems at $200 to $250 is already a hard sell. $400 is a non-event. Perhaps streamed gaming might make it big, but Gaikai won,t be using nvda. nvda is losing customers much much faster than it is gaining new ones.

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: Interesting...Let's see what the Indian Press says: "Xolo, a brand of Lava Mobile, will launch an Nvidia Tegra 4 quad core processor smartphone by March this year. S N Rai, co founder and director of Lava International, told The Mobile Indian, "We are in the process of evaluating the option to launch an Nvidia Tegra 4 smartphone. While Nvidia is yet to release a reference design based on the latest quad core chipset, we are hopeful that we will be able to bring a product based on the chipset by the end of February or March this year". themobileindianDOTcom/news/10047_Quad-core-Xolo-smartphone-this-March "Besides the Range of Six Phones described, Xolo will also be launching a Smartphone that will feature a Nvidia Tegra 4 Quad core Processor by the month of March in the year 2013." 91mobilesDOTcom/blog/20296/Rumor++Lava+to+launch+6+New+Android+Smartphones.html

Topic.Title: Project Shield Will Launch With Nvidia Grid With Telco Partners?

Message.Msg: EXCITING TECHNOLOGY - NEVER MIND IF I NEVER MAKE ANY $$$ OUT OF NVDA! LTENOW I'm up 10% from where I bought this time. Liked the idea of the dividend and the active share buyback along with all the technology. Always thought Nvidia was way too much of a trader option player type stock, but that looks like it's waning. To me it's just a nice growth and income stock with some serious long term potential with an Un Godly amount of cash on the books $6.01 a share.. Excellent presentation at Wedbush. It's worth the time to listen and peruse the Power Point. They got the VP of IR running around the country showing the change. Still have too much hype, but at least Jensen doesn't have to carry all the load like he use too. Institutional ownership is changing too and is up pretty substantially. Note: If you like the Hype be sure and watch Jensen March 19th at the GTC conference keynote....but there is big change this time. Immediately after his address he will make a financial presentation to the analysts and web streaming to the public I hope too. Not sure if you have to be invited. it was unclear in the Wedbush presentation. If they don't put something up soon I expect I will email the VP of Investor relations and ask for the an invite so I can watch.

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: This phone has not been annouced so would not be on their phone list yet androidauthorityDOTcom/lenovo-k900-intel-clover-trail-plus-benchmark-161440/ The K900 has been unveiled at CES in Las Vegas, where we got to take Lenovo’s gorgeous device for a quick spin. Now, the Clover Trail+ equipped device has made an appearance at Mobile World Congress, and we were curious to see how Intel’s first dual-core mobile chip is doing in the benchmarks. The device we got to try was a pre-production model, so it’s possible that the software wasn’t fully optimized, which may explain why the UI occasionally felt sluggish. We installed v3.1.1 of the AnTuTu synthetic benchmark, which tests memory performance, CPU performance, and graphics, and proceeded to run it on the sleek K900. You can see the process and the results in the video below. As you can see, the 2.0GHz Clover Trail+ processor that powers the Lenovo K900 is quite a beast. The device managed an impressive 25,138, which is ahead of the quad-core Snapdragon 600, which just made its debut on the HTC One and the Optimus G Pro. The Qualcomm chip managed a very good 22,678 in an earlier test. Samsung's S4 highest rumored score is 24,300

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: Could be Justfine790 but I'm curious about something else and I know you are Intel employee or a serious Intel stock holder so you probably know the answer to this question. What caused Intel stock to drop Friday? It opened up from previous close of 21.89 and almost hit $22 and then started falling and got all the way down to $21.47, recovered somewhat to closed down 1.4% at $21.58. That is quite a range for Intel. Was their some kind of rumor or news about something? The reason I'm asking is....Intel is always on my watch list because of the high dividend and just wondering if something is up. Seriously.

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: Thanks Getanid61. That's helpful. If Apple did go with Intel, Intel could say goodbye to 60% gross margins forever. Might be able to hold 45% to 50%. But I suspect they would never do that so it's moot. But G/S putting a sell on Intel is serious and based on my experience with other semi's that Goldman put a sell on shareholders of Intel should just sell now or plan on waiting a very long time. GS will stay with the sell and short or do what ever to hit their sell target. Then when they hit their target, they will just lift back to neutral and the stock will slowly rise back up to where it was. Did Goldman give a reason and a price targart? I'm smelling an opportunity down the road.

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: Intel's profit margins will be driven downward by a myriad of factors: --Ipad Mini cannibalizing regular Ipad to a significant extent --the imminent release if a low-price iphone --Business model changing - going after the foundry business which is inherently lower in margin and heavy in capital outlays --uncertainties associated with the change of guard - Otellini leaving and an unproven successor coming in --lower margin for mobile chips in general, assuming that Intel will be successfully break in the communication space in a marginal way ("marginal" is the term a recent WSJ article used in describing Intel's mobile effort) The list goes on - it definitely looks like Intel's low-hanging fruits have all been picked.

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: Thanks Ibexx....but I sit up and take notice when GS puts a sell on a particular semi stock. For example. They put a sell on MCHP in Jan 2012 with a price target of $30, It was $38 at the time I believe. They lifted the sell to neutral in Dec. of 2012 when the stock hit $30 and it's since popped back to $37. I did find their rating history for Intel. They have had a sell on it for a year or so. Just keep lowering their price target...this time from $20 to $16. Geez $16 is 5.6% dividend. They must really hate the company's prospects. The article I read said it all about but the huge rise in Capex. Who knows...they certainly have $$$ behind them to make it happen. Opportunity...Never Short but a buy at $16-$17 around August might be in the cards.

Message.Title: Will Nvidia's share of the graphics market drop to 10% from 16% by year end.
Message.Msg: That is the question BOYS. If it does drop to 10%, Shield can make it up for sure.

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: GS recently downgraded Qualcomm too (last week). So...if both INTC and QCOM downgrades weren't entirely motivated by covering of their short positions, then I must say that GS may be one step ahead of the Wall Street dumb money.

Topic.Title: MISSION X; XOLO to annouce the fastest phone on March 14th

Message.Msg: I don't know about GS being one step ahead of Wall street dumb money....but I do know their semi analysts can make or break a stock just by a two paragraph note sent to their customers and of course through the Chinese Fire Wall to the trading desk. I did notice that the Goldman analyst showed up on Nvidia's Feb conference call for only the 2nd time out of the last 5 calls. Asked about clarification on the Tegra 4 ramp and Opex spending. Thought it was kinda funny but both the VP of investor relations and even Jensen went out of their way to ask whether they had answered his questions and even said will get back with you to make sure! I guess he liked what he heard because he didn't downgrade Nvidia to a sell. He's neutral. I was bracing for a sell with the low guidance, but whatever was said during the conference call and offline placated him. GS is about the only big WS house that puts sells on stocks and people do pay attention to them.
